comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

The bar in the website with the buttons "HOME", "NEWS" , "FORUM" "BLOG", etc.. is covering the Search field.
with chrome it is visualized properly

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open the webpage
2. see how the search field is covered by the bar of home, news, forum, blog, etc
3.
Actual Results:  
the search field is covered by the bar of home, news, forum, blog, etc


Expected Results:  
the search field shouldn't be covered by that bar, but should be able to be viewed clearly (like it does in Chrome)
comments.creator: martindrummer@libero.it

comments.text:
WFM - Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110417 Firefox/6.0a1 ID:20110417030531

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#Make_a_new_profile

Please attach a screenshot showing the issue if it persists in safe mode and with a new profile
comments.creator: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com

sorry i meant only in safe mode (here's the link for the screenshot http://img545.imageshack.us/i/safemode.png/, i already highlighted the area in which the error occours)
I can't open the profile manager-creator using the terminal, as soon as i put the string in the terminal and press the enter button, it says 
"dyld: unknown required load command 0x80000022
Trace/BPT trap "
and the firefox-bin window that show up when a program crashes (asking if i wanna report the problem to apple) shows up
